lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instead of using the table, though, you use Grog's knee. You just run, jump onto his knee with one foot, leap off, blade in the air, go for the strike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what that is! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is seven points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ugh. You guys, I thought someone was going to kill him!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I tried, but he hurt my wrist really bad!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, because I don't want to fucking burn any spells on this asshole.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just hit him with your stick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Goddamn it, this hopefully works-- nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heavy armor on these guys. All right. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh gosh. I guess I shoot him. Can I see him to shoot him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move over there and get a better view a little bit. Just around this corner, off the table.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm going to Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I'm going to shoot him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh gosh, I'm just so nervous about picking the 20. No. 19?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? The arrow hits the armor and shatters across the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a high AC. Because of the shield, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of the shield and the armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hits some sort of core where its arcane form is held and the reddish energy blinks out, and the armor just (impact noise) crumples to the ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I immediately turn my attention to Cassandra. Can I do a medical check on her to make sure she's okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a medicine check, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I start running out the hall to Ripley.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Trinket is still running after her, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, make a perception check for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. (laughs) Okay, is it his smelling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm rolling a big dice for Trinket! Oh, that's good. 26!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25, okay. Trinket is giving chase best it can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Trinket is keeping track, but is having a hard time fully keeping up at this point unless you're giving full attention towards him at this point in time, but is keeping a track. He is rushing as fast as he can down the stairs and is currently out of your sphere of personal influence at the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I should have Hunter's Marked her. (sighs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab Scanlan, and we're taking off after her out the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a 17 on a medicine check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, checking Cassandra, there is no sign of a wound now. She seems to be not in any danger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, she's on the ground, dazed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to collapse in a corner for a minute and start using my ascot to clean some of the gore off my weapon and my clothing and my mask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a lot of gore. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we out of combat now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are currently out of combat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to, clutching my bleeding belly, walk over toward Keyleth and say, that was a close one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. You know, I feel like we've been here before-- oh, right. We have been here before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know I'm in love with you, right? And I kiss her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) And on that note, we're going to go ahead and take a quick little break!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see what color you turned. Oh my god, yeah! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, awesome. Quick break, guys! See you guys back here in a few minutes.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Couple quick things, guys, or I could just sit here and talk for a good ten minutes, make you guys wait before we come back to the bombshell that was dropped. I'm just going to keep going. We are 15 away from doing a giveaway, if we hit that 15 we will be doing that giveaway at the very end of this stream, right whenever Matt says that's it. We will open up the chat for everyone and do that giveaway. I also want to say for all the people wondering what in the world was the No Survivors thing, Snakes on a Plane number one was this last Monday, and it's up on the website right now if you guys are curious and want to check it out, it's probably the funniest thing we've ever done on this channel, and I don't say that lightly. But we're doing Snakes on a Plane 2 this coming Monday, so thanks, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Snakes on a Plane 2: More Snakes, More Plane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. With the chaos that has ensued through the battle in Anders's study in the castle of Whitestone, the party looks about, Cassandra de Rolo recovered, and pulled from seemingly the brink of death. Vax pulled seemingly from the brink of death, and Percy managing to squeak in a second killshot on a member of his list. As the rest period kicks in, Vax stepped across the room, holding his wound to his side, admitting his affection for Keyleth, and reaching out and kissing her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as he breaks from the momentary, unexpected embrace, you catch yourself off guard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, the way you turn into animals and stuff is really cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to collect some of Vex's arrows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I leave the room and look for Trinket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll do a 4th level. Shut up, Sam. I just can't find my spell. Yeah, I'll do that 4th-level Cure Wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Burn all the spell slots. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Folks, we don't know what we're doing. None of us know what we're doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like in the moment I would just do it really at a-- shut up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. What do I roll? Hang on. 1d8. So I'm rolling 4d8. I need d8s, goddamn it! Give me d8s.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why can't I have your d8s?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's fine, give me one more.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm collecting three or four of Vex's arrows from the ground and getting them in my hand, and I'm staying back from all of this and letting it happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Collect the arrows, Vex has stepped out of the room to pursue after Trinket, Trinket is currently pursuing Ripley. Grog, you watched that happen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, Grog and Scanlan ran out of the room after Ripley.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, have you guys bolted out? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I feel better. Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good. I'm going to now take my handful of what is now basically a switch, and I'm going to start whacking him with it really hard on the chest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You! Don't go into rooms by yourself, god damn it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I back into a corner upon seeing this, as Percy ruins the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival, he had a knife to your sister's throat. He was going to kill her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, but count to ten. And now I drop them and go over to my sister.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was afraid she was going to die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, you did get her throat slit, but it's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're saying this, you turn around, you can see she's sat up and she sees this conversation and goes, "Percy?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And she gets up off the ground and runs up and just grabs you and embraces you tightly. You can feel all the muscles tense in her body as she just holds you with a slight shake to her body.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so sorry for leaving you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I thought you were dead." She pulls away for a second and just looks at you, and there's a coldness to her face. She's happy, but even for her young age, you can see there's lines at the corners of her eyes. She's probably been through a lot. She smiles and looks up at you again and you can see there's the white shocks in her hair, and she looks up and touches your hair and goes, "I see "we've both survived quite a bit."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She laughs to herself, and you see another tear curl at her eye, and then her face goes cold for a second and she, not breaking this gaze, steps back. "You shouldn't be here. They were "using me to get to you. I'm so sorry."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you all right? Did they do anything? Are you yourself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She reaches up and holds her neck. "I'm good. I'm good." And she steels herself for a second, and even more so, you see there's an intensity to her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Insight. I want to make sure she's not holding anything really important back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Insight? Do I get a bonus for that right now? It's a wisdom-- yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is not a saving throw, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and that's wisdom, not a saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. Okay. Best you can tell, she seems very honest. She seems forthright. You're used to the memory of your sister being this bright-eyed, cheerful, youngest of the bunch, and definitely a woman who sees the world with fresh eyes. These eyes are different. They're colder. They're hardened. In ways, you're impressed; in ways, you're also immediately sad to see that that memory of your sister probably is no longer there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're putting an end to the Briarwoods tonight. Before the sun sets. This is the end of them. It's all going to be over, and we're going to stop whatever it is they're doing under the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's what the others thought. You left me, you know."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, and I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. Well, if we're going to do this, let's get ready."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To wait until this is over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. No, I'm not. I'm going to my room to get my things. To get my mother's armor."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sputters) You're-- I don't think that's a very good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've been fighting them for what, a few days? I've been fighting them for nearly three "years. You have no power over me, brother. And if our goals are aligned to free this city, let's do "it together. But I don't have to listen to you."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She walks out of the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, charging off. Trinket's keeping trail. She's run down the stairway, he is beginning to slowly gain on her. She reaches the front doors, does remember the caltrops. Jumps over them, grabs the door, opens it, and rushes out into the daylight. Go ahead and roll a perception check for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He saw it happen! He's got really good vision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Trinket just jumps over. The door's only slightly open so Trinket has to stop and wedge his way through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can he cannonball into her? To try to catch her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the same speed as if he dashed. It would be the same speed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys now get down the stairs. As Trinket opens the door and wedges through, there's a scent out there, but she's nowhere in visible range. She's either darted off the path or possibly off the actual sides, and you can see now the struggle that's happened. You can now hear in the distance the sound of yells and fighting and there doesn't appear to be any one side or the other pushing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I whistle at Trinket to get him to stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you get to the landing you whistle out, and Trinket is just now pushing through the door and gets out for a bit, looking back and forth. Looks over the shoulder, and runs back to you. It appears that Ripley has scattered into Whitestone somewhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to find the Briarwoods.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm still upstairs. Are you going to come meet us again upstairs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll get Trinket and go back upstairs, wherever they are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're waiting there. They followed her down; I'm waiting on Cassandra.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I could stay down in that foyer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you waiting in the study?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, she goes off to her room. You're there for a few minutes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We come back and say, that Ripley is very talented. She got away. Talented Dr. Ripley.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have bigger issues than Anna at this point. Grog, do you have the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you scoop up what's left of Professor Anders?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I loot him first? I mean, just see what's on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't want any of him sticking around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have to put him in the Bag of Holding, though?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why can't we just set him on fire?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, stuff him in a closet or something for now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there a fireplace in the room?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is. Throw him in. Fine, we'll throw him in the fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Let me see what's on him, first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't want him coming back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's crumpled up against the desk in the corner, there's all these papers that got pushed off the side, there were a bunch of random scrawlings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do find, however, the boots that he's wearing are very finely crafted, and unlike the rest of his wear, have a hand-stitching in it that is exemplary in construction and doesn't match with the rest of his ensemble. So it seems like something you'd wear more for function than for actual style. Pardon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anybody have magic? Can you see what these are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, I can look at them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, if you're taking a short rest, you can take the short rest to inspect the boots, get the feel for them, they are indeed enchanted. They are a pair of Boots of Levitation. Once per day, you can trigger the levitation for up to ten minutes as per the spell. You can't actually move as part of it, you just levitate in the air, and you have to push off to get space.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we're playing with that later.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll just hang onto it. I'll just hold onto it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we all just try them once when we get back to Greyskull Keep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you want to do while you're waiting?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything else in the room? Can I sniff around the room and investigate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I drag Anders over to the fireplace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He doesn't quite fit, so I have to snap some joints.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good. As you're looking through and finding papers, papers and ledgers and tough discussions of old classes, untouched on the side, you go through one of the bottom drawers, and there's a lock to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vax, do you need my help to unlock it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, Shorty. Hold on. Are there any traps in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does appear to be trapped.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It does appear to be trapped?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what do I roll to undo that? Dexterity? Lockpick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thieves' tools, as well. So same check you did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I can open it for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a natural 20, so that's untrapped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As part of that, you notice that this mechanism is when it opens, if there isn't a switch underneath it held that's hidden, it will cause a poison dart to launch out in the direction of whoever's in front of it. You hold the button, you find it, you open it up without an issue, and you find the spring mechanism, snap it, and remove the little poison-tipped bolt, and chuck it to the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, wait. Give me that. I take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You have a poison-tipped bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For a tiny little hand-crossbow is essentially what it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So now I've got to unlock it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, okay. Easy enough to unlock at this point, you get it open, you pull it open, there's a collection of letters.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival, come here. You're probably the best person to know what to make of these.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance through and inspect them, and you take the next ten minutes or so to get the gist of these letters while Cassandra's away. Many of them talk about a slew of things that are disconcerting to you as the information hits you, and you relay this information to the group. Notes on the removal of key magical defenses during the political meeting at Emon. The discussion, as in making sure that certain individuals and safeguards that are usually made during political meetings like that were not present during that endeavor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Notes on best construction methods using the mined whitestone and repairs for the manse in the ziggurat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A manse is a place or a home; it has many different meanings. They're warning Anders, and there are multiple letters at different periods of time over the past few years that are warning Anders of an arrival of Seeker Asum's spies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are letters talking about plotting, diverting political attention away from Whitestone to leave it a political enigma during this period of time. There are letters talking about planting information within Wildmount that would lead their investigation team to believe the Briarwoods had been found dead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a whole paper trail!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And occasionally there are mentions in a lot of these letters that speak of, "The Undying King "shall return, we are his blood."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did she get Jarl from?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay? Are they all of the same hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are all of the same handwriting. In the cluster, there is one completely unrelated letter that talks about business ledgers and construction of the bridge. It appears to be a simple discussion on the future plans to construct the bridge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that in the same hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is in the same handwriting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is signed a Lord Riskel Daxio.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's on the Council of Tal'Dorei.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's technically also the one that helped designate the construction of your keep and plotted the construction stuff--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's the construction guy, he's like our head builder.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He could be spying on us around the keep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He could have a secret entrance to our Keep that he built and didn't tell us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As soon as I see that, I go down in a crouch and I shit-scry on our keep to see if it's still there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god, that's right, you did that! And I put an elemental there. It's babysitting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 days. Glancing within the kitchen, there doesn't appear to be much that catches your attention.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I put a mound of shit in a jar in the kitchen and I told them, don't clean it up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got Anders in the fireplace, and I light the Firebrand War Hammer with the magic word, bacon, and I hit it and set him on fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was already a fire in the fireplace, but you just stoke it a little further, and pretty soon the delicious scent of burning human flesh fills the room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, bacon. Did you not know that's what the word was?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So everything's fine at the keep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At least, there's nothing on fire, there's no screams, there's no movement. It just seems like the cold kitchen is untouched.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've squeezed all you're going to be able to get out of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy. Can we get into the underground caverns from here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I think of a way? I'm assuming I know a way to where this might be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you have this conversation, a voice from the doorway rings out. "I can take you." You look over, and it's Cassandra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's currently now dressed in armor you've seen as ornamental before. It was armor that your mother trained in when she was young, but was unused for a long time. It seems to be serviceable; it's been updated and such. She slides a shortsword into a sheath at her side, and her hair is pulled back and tied off, and she looks at the rest of the room. "So are we ready?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She steps up and lifts her chin up towards you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, this is Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to insight check as he does that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: These are my friends, by the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I see anything on her neck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It seems fine. There's no signs of any puncture wounds. Rolling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. She seems as determined as the rest of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She turns around and she begins walking back down the hallway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we expect any more traps that you're aware of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So be wary. Be careful. I'll take you to the undercroft."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we just have a short rest here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Percival. Any chance you can load up one of Ripley's guns for me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if it will actually-- I would have to probably train you in how to use it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really? I've seen you use it. You just pull your finger on the finger part and the big boom part goes out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a little more complicated than that, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you have to point it at the thing you want to be boomed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He could use it, he just wouldn't be able to add his proficiency bonus to the attack rolls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll load one for you. I'll give him her boomstick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take it. You inspect it as you guys are walking along.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just making sure it functions, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ammunition she does have are made specific to size to her pistol. They will not function for the Pepperbox, unfortunately. They will only work for the pistol.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doing okay. Not doing great, but I'm doing okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does act as a pistol for rules-wise, which is on your sheet here, so yes, you would have that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want it? Just in case yours misfires?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll steal it back from him if I need, but it should be fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Athletics. See if I can spin it around and put it in my pocket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, where did you get it? I had it in my belt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll dexterity, roll a d20, add your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is literally how she lost her hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what's this? Why does it say plus four?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This music is awful as you're checking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, it's zero, but it says a big plus four next to it for some reason.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know. Add zero. What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully it's not loaded, because you feel the trigger go off. But there wasn't a bullet loaded, so it's like (click).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we took out the ammunition.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, now give me a bullet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hand him the ammunition. I load four of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a big boy. Well, I'm a little boy. But I'm a little big boy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to walk past Scanlan and grab it out of his hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will prevent him from doing that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys are fighting over a loaded gun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Add your athletics to your roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you go to be, "No, what are you--" It's already gone. You don't even know where it went, you didn't see him take it, you just all of a sudden see it in his hand as he walks past you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I walk over to Cassandra. I don't give her the gun, I just say, you're Cassandra?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was at the door. He had a knife to your throat. He wanted you to say something to us. What did he want you to say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He wanted me to shout for help. He wanted me to draw you in."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I insight check her to see if she's telling the truth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've been living here. How did it come that he had a blade to your throat today? How did it all unravel? Have you been living here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, after the arrows felled me-- I guess I should start at the beginning." And she's walking along with you guys as she's leading you down the stairs and down to the bottom floor. She doesn't look to you. She's still looking ahead, very intent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take that pistol back from you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Archibald still lives, Percy. He's been completely necessary for what we've built here." She looks down at her armor as you guys reach the edge of the cellar, and she pulls the door open quietly. There's wooden stairs that lead down into the cellar. She taps her armor. "This was "Mother's. It's good to know I'm not the only tomboy in the bloodline." Brushes the hair out of her face, and for the first time really looks at you with a smile since she first saw you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) Can we do one thing before we go down into the cellar? This is the best day of my life, and I can't help but be suspicious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there any way to check if she's being controlled?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was thinking the same thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can we put your helmet on her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only thing you really have seen work is the Greater Restoration spell you cast on Seeker Asum when you guys were with the Council of Tal'Dorei. That did seem to remove any sort of charm effects, if that's what you're asking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't learn it. Not for today. I thought Pike's magic would hold up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can try and jog her memory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What can I do to make you trust me?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do trust you. That's the problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She smiles a little. "Whatever you need."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does anyone have any creative means with which they would want to check?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What would happen if we put your helmet on her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could try it. It doesn't hurt to put a hat on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It has to be attuned over a short rest, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does the hat need to be attuned over a short rest?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to suggest something to you. We rest here for a half hour, and I give this to you. This came from a very strange creature. It will help you resist any control, if there is any control, and one of us-- you could even choose-- could strike you and try to take you out of it, and if you are not being controlled, then you are being struck across the face, and I'm sorry for that, but if you are, there's a possibility we'd pull you out. I know that would hurt, but it would go a long way to earn our trust.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If that's what it takes." She takes it from your hand and inspects it for a second. "Shoddy "craftsmanship." Places it on her head, and it's a little big at first, then it conforms to her head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She sits down a couple of steps deeper into the cellar. Curls around a corner; ushers you all over into the shadows.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see, before we leave, are we near any windows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this location? No. All the windows that would be here would face out into the north side of Whitestone, which is forested.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are on the north side of the castle now. The city is south from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What if the little one struck you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives a wry grin. "Whatever you choose."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. I don't think she's evil. She could be a puppet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're immune to charm effects. Or we have resistance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Advantage against saves. Since we have that, can we use our fey ancestry, the three of us, to tap into her and see if we can detect a charm?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your resistance doesn't make you attuned to it. Unfortunately, it's just a natural ability that's inherent. Her being human, there's not a way to really correlate with that. I mean, you've read over her a few times, doing insight checks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a potion. This should solve all of our problems.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or you could save that for when one of us becomes a vampire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She puts her hand out. Her leather glove's pulled over it now. You've never seen her militant before, and it's a really interesting visual to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives a wry grin and wipes her mouth. "I thought I recognized that terrible earthy taste." She tosses the crystal decanter to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Huh. You always were the clever one."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I figured it was worth a shot. Best we're going to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I supposed to punch her in the face now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She hands it back to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a fascination she has with her armor. "I've not been able to wear this before. It "feels good to have something close to Mother."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Simon repaired it for me when he was working here. I haven't seen him in a while. I'm "worried."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leads you down through the cellar--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, hang on. Before we enter: it's safe to assume they know we're coming, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can ask her anything you'd like.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are the Briarwoods going to be down there? Are they here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "I have no confirmation of it, but they spend most of their time down here. They're "preparing for something."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have you ever been down here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've only gotten so far before I had to return, but I've made it through the undercroft, through "most of the tunnels, and I've gotten to the distillery, and that's about as far as I've "gotten. But I've followed them down here, and they usually come with a group of guards, "four or five strong."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there sentries? Can we expect to find traps, lookouts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's definitely a possibility, so move quietly. Be careful."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is Lady Briarwood? She's a wicked beast of a creature, is what she is. I'd use less "savory words, but my brother's here."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a first time for everything, I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she leads you guys down the stairs towards the undercroft, she goes, "She's not like "her husband. That I know. As far as I can tell, she's human, but she has a very powerful control "over life and death. She's a practitioner of the arcane, definitely, but her focus seems to be "necromancy on a wide scale. And while Delilah and Sylas are man and wife, they speak of another."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The guy that they're trying to bring back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's as if a third party completes their union."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, this is the king that will rise again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They don't say any names. They refer to him as 'him' or 'The Whispered One.' No reference "beyond that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) What if it's the guy in Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm having that thought, as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's playing both sides, possibly, Percival.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, another question for Cassandra. The duke, Negmeyer? Vegmeyer? Venkman?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vedmeyer. Have you seen him around the castle today, or recently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've only seen him in the castle maybe three times since we've been here."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a big goliath, so if he's here, you should just, you know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, when I was a dinosaur and I burned down a house and killed a bunch of people...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a series of words that I know individually, but he strings them together in ways that don't make any sense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wouldn't say fought, because I beat him really easily, and then I ran away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I just pushed him off a building, then I thought that was enough for the day, so I went home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's a shame you're not as tall as your tales, "small one."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, thank you. I'll take that as a compliment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we cross the precipice into this-- what is it, undercroft?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Undercroft she was referring to, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percival, we all have fought with you this whole time, and you know that we have your back and that we're with you in this 100 percent. But I'd like our enemies to know that, as well, so with your permission, I will cast Seeming on all of us. And I make the girls look like Cassandra, and the boys look like Percy. So I give us all the gray hair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if possible, I'd like to emblazon the sign of the rebellion on our chests in sort of an awesome Superman glowing thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a flicker of Scanlan's arcane mastery, all of you form into a small battalion of Percys and Cassandras.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He would have to be, yeah, because he still stays similar to his actual size, so if Percy was a little thicker and a little taller--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he's wearing little circle glasses.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, with the little glasses. We are all de Rolos today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cassandra looks around very confused for a second. "Curious, yes."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But abrasive. Right? You're put off by it, so it works. It's working.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Abrasiveness is his most powerful weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So I'm beginning to see. Well, then." She pulls her shortsword out. "Shall we?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going in to fight now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As are we all." Everyone roll stealth checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I cast Pass Without a Trace? Yeah, I'm going to use Pass Without a Trace, because I don't have a lot of 2nd-level spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, plus ten to your stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I thought you rolled a natural 20?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I gave her my fucking cloak, Matt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we all get plus ten?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before we go in, I go, Vax?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do you know it's him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, it's me, Vax. What do you need? It's me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is really creepy because it's brother and sister talking to each other right now. It looks like Percival and Cassandra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's very uncomfortable right now, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anybody who is not made uncomfortable by this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This was supposed to be a passing comment, and it's turned into a thing. (laughs) Be careful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God damn it! I can't do this anymore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just go. Let's go. Can we go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sister Vex? Do you mind giving me that gun again?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It will be no problem at all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why, because I'm three feet tall?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (imitating Grog) Is this the body-switching episode?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is anyone holding a torch light source, going through this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got his flaming war hammer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, and I'll light up my hands.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I still have a torch, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have you been carrying it with you throughout this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you have enough light sources to keep a general idea of what's going on, and I know a lot of you guys have darkvision, too, so you have a pretty decent range. What's the marching order here, guys? Just so I know, continuing down this path.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll go Percy, Cassandra, Cassandra, Percy, Percy, Percy, Percy, Cassandra.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Boy girl, boy girl, boy girl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to perception ahead, so I'll be towards the front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How about Grog in second place? You big sponge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Trinket staying with you or staying in back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's going to stay further back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Put me in a happy middle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog's second. Keyleth is, you said, in the middle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, the rest of you guys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Scanlan, you staying towards the back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll be behind Grog, as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I'll be in the back with my sister.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and this is Cassandra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so it's like a flying V formation you guys are pushing in here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Go home, de Rolo, you're drunk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. You progress through the undercroft as quietly as possible. You notice as you get past the first section, you look to your right and left and the inside of these small like cubby offshoots that contain these separate ten by ten stone tombs. The walls have shelves burrowed into it, in which there are urns and small gems and offerings-- things that were buried alongside the family members as part of a remembrance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, no. Don't go Skyrim on me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And the closer you get, you see large piles of dirt that fill one side of the room were put off to the side as if pieces of this dig were discarded and there is a trail of dirt across the ground that appears to have not been very well cleaned to show that dirt was being moved in and out of this area. You also see, as you push two-thirds into the room, broken pieces of whitestone that had been carved into what looks like parts of walls or pillars. Support things that failed in their construction and just broke and were tossed and discarded to the side. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of you Critters out there has to get Taliesin a really, really pretty new d20 that he has to use going forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what did you get?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't remember. It wasn't very good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Those of you with about 25 or above, you glance and you find two of these slivers of this material you don't recognize and part of this broken stone. It's like a dark green glass. About a half an inch to an inch thick in slivers. You only find a small scattering few, and it has a grainy texture to it, and you take a look at it, and it's transparent. You can see shapes through it, but it's opaque enough to the point where it distorts a little bit of the visual and color behind it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check on this? Is this similar to the broken glass that I collected before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which broken glass you collected before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. I just have broken glass shards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like that was the red stones or something from before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like there was some sort of--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was that sea of glass.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we were in some cavern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, the sea of bone and glass? Okay. Yeah, it is not similar to that, no. However, those who are trained in arcana, you can go ahead and make an arcana roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do you know if you're trained in arcana?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would have filled in, if you have a proficiency.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have really no idea what this glass is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was just me? I'm the only arcana-trained person here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I try a nature check on it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's like, "It's not going to tell you shit, but sure." 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's glass. Most glass you understand is designed by usually sand or other materials that at a high temperature or some sort of process is melted and fused.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be, or naturally occurred, and the structure of it has this bumpy, wavy-- it's not like smooth glass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of. But you're not sure what it actually is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if this was holding that acid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wonder if something very, very hot...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm wondering if it's a symptom of something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When they burn the whitestone with the acid or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I see any recent tracks around here? Does it look like people came down here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check with advantage because you're a crazy ranger tracker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see tracks here and there, some fresher than others. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many of us found this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, two of you saw it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk away from the group all the way to the back, and I take it--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, towards where we came from. What's behind us? Is it just tunnel back that way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You mean on that path you're going?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I push through the back of the group to the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where you just came from is the stairs that lead up to the castle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was going to throw it, but...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I see Vex looking around. Can I look for tracks as well? I'm proficient in survival, and I never use it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you sit there inspecting the dirt--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like there's some tracks here, but I don't know what it's saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you immediately see a cluster of recent footprints, probably a day old at most, that lead in towards the tunnel. Looks like the prints are of seven individuals. Feet are fairly wide, masculine and heavy in step. One gait appears to be smaller, thinner, and more feminine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many tombs are open around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, 20 and above that'd be just you two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah, three. All right, so you three, you notice the temperature drop ever so slightly in the room and in the darkened shadow. you look around and you see what appears to be some sort of ethereal mass drifting away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God damn it! Here we go again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you have a surprise round right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog and Vex are out here checking this. You guys are back here. Keyleth is here. Vax, you're back here. Trinket's up with you, and Scanlan you're--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're over here with these guys. You see one drifts out from this side, another drifts out from this side, and another drifts in from this side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a cold chill that runs down the spine of Keyleth and Vax, as they've encountered enemies similar to this in the past.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's that fucking shit that turned us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, let's roll some initiatives.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm changing dice. This is bullshit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'm banning that d20 for the rest of the game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It makes no sense. Yes! It's a hollow die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a hollow die. There's nothing to be weighted on it. It's a wiffle die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's just you. Okay, so! Initiatives.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Percy, you're up first. You glance around, and you can see the two entities going (hiss) towards you, towards Keyleth, and you glance over your shoulder and see one drifting out of the distance towards Vax.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I yell, "Look out!" And I take several steps toward Vax.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, on the other side of the pillar so I can actually see the one that's getting towards him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You won't be able to see this one, just those. This one actually will block your view to that one. These are about ten feet tall. These are the little sections here, so right now, you would be able to see these two here and barely see this one. It would have three-quarters cover. Which you ignore, with Sharpshooter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. I want to back up into that corner, though, just to get away from them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you can see one of them right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take-- fuck. Yep, screw it. I'll take shots with the Pepperbox.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With a different die. Of course, with a different die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm the devil. I am the devil, and I have come to do the devil's work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So all of you who are going to conventions to meet Taliesin in the future, make sure you get a nice long hold of his hand so you can roll better, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, would you touch my dice?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will lick your die, because that is how I bless them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, all against the same guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First attack is 22 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, is this with the element, or not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You fire. Just passes through it with no effect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn misty dudes. I'm mocking them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take a picture. Take a picture right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: CritRoleStats, how many is that? Tell us! I know you've been counting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll put it on Instagram later.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I go to Vegas. I don't gamble!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You need to go find the D&D casino.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: D&D casino. Make it happen, guys. I know one of you can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 14 points of damage, plus three damage of fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Including the crit damage. I rolled really poorly on my damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so this one, the bullet does (impact noise) hit its form with a burst of flame, the bullet converted to magical due to the nature of the chamber. You can see its form (raspy cry). It disperses for a second and then re-forms, continuing its movement.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need magic! I'm taking my last shot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was seven, by the way. Seven 20s this game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. They're easy to hit, at least. That's such a shitty roll. 12 points of ice damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The ice shot (gunshot) tears through it, doing additional damage. You see part of its form crystallize from the little bit of ectoplasm that's floating in the air, but it's not enough to actually disperse its form. It continues pushing forward. You would have to reload to use those again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that ends your turn. It's now their go. This one drifts forward to Keyleth. This one drifts forward to Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's with our surprise round? You said we have a surprise round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys were aware. Everyone else is surprised.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we're the only three that aren't surprised. Oh, that sucks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Unless you do anything against surprise?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true. All right. Keyleth, I need you to make a constitution saving throw. Sorry, no, a charisma saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A charisma saving throw? That's not great. And no saving throw bonuses, okay, so that's ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten. Okay. The ghost reaches out and embraces Keyleth. It disappears into her form and she shivers for a second, and it is no longer visible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he's taken over her body?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth's eyes all of a sudden flare up with a ghostly blue glow, and she turns around, looking at the group with a hunger you haven't seen in her eyes. For those who see it, as well-- I should have made this happen before-- I need you guys to immediately after seeing these ghosts make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just the ones that see it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all immune to fear because of the feast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, so never mind. That doesn't matter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good reminding. So I was right, then. I didn't forget anything! All right, charisma saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. This is not a charm.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. A flaming arrow (impact noise) sticks into the shoulder, and you can feel the flames burning into your body--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus another five. That was another five burning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's now Cass's turn. Cass, who's having a weird time with the whole process of seeing a bunch of herselves and her brothers stabbing each other and getting possessed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we even know who's who?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for that. I was almost going there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's right there, and she brings herself around the way. She's not able to do any actions, so she sees another of her brothers possessed but clutching the gun in the hand, and is steeling her blade for the moment and doesn't do anything with her turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is no one a Sam Raimi fan? Never mind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 17 for the first one. 19 for the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so 36 points of damage. (two impacts) You're thrown up against the wall and almost pushed over off your feet from the sheer weight of the impact.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It has to be magic damage, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was. It's a magic war hammer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so it's taking damage, too. That's good. Maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It seems that the radiant damage from the Spirit Guardian spell you're doing has been doing the bulk of damage to them while they're inside the form. Most everything else is going straight to the individual.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've just been killing our friends for no reason?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy. You have three more shots with this gun, two of which are magical.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you pull up the gun, you take a step back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does he get an attack of opportunity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. Attack of opportunity against Percy, if you want to take it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's actually the first time I've critted on this show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the first time you've critically hit on this show?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think so, because I've never doubled my dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage. I want to know what it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, go ahead, but I'm out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 18, so-- what was the first one? 18 and?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You are out. Percy falls to the ground, unconscious. The spirit is jettisoned out the side. That ends your turn entirely. The ghost is going to shift over. It does not get its possession back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was just a crit. It wasn't hit twice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It wasn't when he was down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, I need you to make a death saving throw, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With you on the ground and its possession not returned, it reaches down and strikes at you with its withering touch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take two death saving throw losses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an auto-crit because he's unconscious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But you passed your first one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you have two failures on you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have two failures and one success. So guys? Heal me. Heal me now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start sprinting around that open hallway near Cassandra. I stop by Cassandra and dagger, dagger, dagger.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First one is 30. Second one is 15. Third is 28.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They all hit? Good. Ten plus seven is 17. 27 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so all daggers strike through its form. You see it tearing through its ethereal physicality, but it's still holding its form together. It looks damaged, but it's still holding its form on this plane. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 35? Can I run the "west" of the way--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The "west" of the way through it in front of Percy. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I want to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I vault over Keyleth's body, using the right part of a buttcheek to launch off. Grab a little feel as I go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I try to get within 15 feet of the thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And as my first thing, I will Healing Word Mr. Taliesin Jaffe. Percival de Rolo de Monico de Chico...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just at normal level, so that's nine points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your death saving throws are fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus. I don't want to burn another fucking thing on this guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your aura thingy with 15 feet should do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but that's when he moves, not when I move, so I will mock him! I will say, you're not even corporeal. You have no substance. You're a nothing. You're a nobody! You won't amount to nothing in this world! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) You're a nothing. You're a nobody!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) How do you want to do this? (cheers and laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (giggles) I would like it to cry. That's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) As you're shouting this, you can see its ghostly form. Its face suddenly shifts into the face of a person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were nothing in life, and now you're nothing in death!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see it look at its hands, and you see it look at you and look at Percy on the ground, unconscious, and it moans out in horror as it suddenly dissipates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which one of my ancestors did you just shame to death? Again?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to say it, aren't you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I double back to Keyleth and start trying to administer some sort of aid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make a medicine check to try to stabilize her, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, yeah. You stabilize the bleeding. She's no longer making death saving throws. She is still unconscious. You all reconvene. Take a breath.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She needs help. Scanlan, come here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will sing a song of rest, which will give us 1d8 for everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For hit dice spent, or just for the rest?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. It just says 1d8. It's my song of rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got a lot of health potions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we take a short rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of the short rest, everyone gains an additional 1d8. It's nice. Doesn't hurt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I come to consciousness by Scanlan's singing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) You're down with more HP. Yeah, you know me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we can roll some hit dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys take a short rest here to roll some hit dice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groans) Wait, how much did you heal us, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just one extra d8. Do I roll that, or do they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone rolls it on their own. It's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we never do that again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we're about to, I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in a tomb with ghosts. We have to continue on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll heal, but I think we need to continue down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cassandra looks about the rest of you, still seeing a group of herself and her brothers. She shakes her head for a second. "We can rest a moment, but I don't think we can stay here much "longer. The more time we spend here, the more chance they have of returning. If they get the "jump on us, we're done."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Into the tunnel. Into the dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) "Let's do this." As you all climb into the beginning of the excavation tunnel leading to the south, slowly making your way towards--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait! Sorry. Percival, any point in looting?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry! Forget I mentioned it. Let's go kick some ass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Making your way towards the tunnels beneath the city of Whitestone, towards whatever this ziggurat construction project has been, we will pick this up the week after Thanksgiving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh man! We're taking a whole week off from this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. We went a little late tonight to try and give a little extra since we're not going to be here next week, but that's it for the evening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We almost got our ass kicked by ghosts!

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We've got to do a giveaway, so I am opening the floodgates.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might need to burn a Cure Wounds or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not at a hundred, but I'm okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I burned almost all of my hit dice to bring me back up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ashley is getting home right now, in case we need her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can she come in for 30 seconds and heal us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, I got a little bit of a connection! And gone. That's all.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We also got up to $6,000 total so far, raised.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: So we will continue that throughout the weekend, all the way up to Monday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you all so much for helping out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're helping a lot of wonderful people do a lot of amazing things in places that need it.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: So the floodgates are open. We're going to let that build up for a little bit and then do the giveaway.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Oh shoot, that's true. The next episode is Critmas, as well, isn't it?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Is there not? There's one before it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we're doing the Christmas Critmas a little bit earlier, so we're going to do the next one before we go on Christmas break, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the 3rd is the next Critmas. Because the 17th, our last show, is also the opening night of the new Star Wars movie, we can't go late that night because everyone's going to be gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. So yeah, we can't do Critmas next week.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: And we've already told everyone the first week of the month is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So the Christmas Critmas is going to be the 3rd.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that will be the Crit--

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: All right, pull in a winner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've got a winner coming in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't we just do it the second week? It's going to be a long episode. We'll have to cut it super short.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was thinking. Can we move it to the second week?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Christmas Critmas is going to be the 10th.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Before we officially say that, let me check the schedule, because we've already told everyone the first week, so before we say that officially, let me check the schedule and make sure that's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to be really hard to do it on the 3rd.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm literally leaving the studio on the 17th for a road trip.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We're sending you a message right now. Send back with your address and we'll send you all sorts of great shit. Tune in tomorrow, guys, for Group Hug. Hector's bringing a couple of comedian friends of his, and they are playing all of the Jessica Jones Alias characters tomorrow, and nobody wanted to play Purple Man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Creepiest character in the Marvel universe.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Whoever plays him has to know you're going to get your ass kicked.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's Tennant. That's also who I dressed up as at the superhero party. I painted myself purple.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: You did Purple Man? Why would you do that?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's an amazing photo of a friend of ours dressed as Luke Cage, just beating the shit out of me. It's amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm just excited to see all the Doctor Who Tennant fans watch the series for Tennant and then be like, "Oh no, no, no!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just going to be bad.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Sweet. That's it for tonight, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the next episode. See you guys in two weeks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There will still be a new comic next week to hold you guys over. And playlists. Guess whose playlist is next.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does the DM get a playlist?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He does, but he'll go last. Because you always go last.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see you in a couple of weeks.
